newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Martinair plans air cargo rate increases.
newsitem.headline: Martinair plans air cargo rate increases.

text.p: Martinair NV is to announce a series of price increases on its scheduled and ad hoc airfreight services in the next few days, vice president cargo and sales, Meta Ullings told Reuters.
She said in a telephone interview Martinair has been studying the market and will impose increases designed to take effect from October 1.

She added "Pressure on costs has been an important factor, we're looking at all the routes and working out where we can increase and that process has been underway since late last week. I cannot at this stage be specific about the size of increases or the routes."
She said the recent increased cost of jet kerosene is one factor, and that the recently increased oil price is expected to bring about further keroseine increases in the next few weeks.
Ullings added that Lufthansa Cargo's decision recently to hike its rates is being taken into consideration: "At least someone else has the strength of mind to increase rates," she added.
Martinair is 50 percent owned by KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
